description: Id of the run that completed the task
name: runId

fields.description: Deadline of the task, pending and running runs are resolved as exception if not resolved by other means before the deadline. Note, deadline cannot be more than 5 days into the future
fields.name: deadline

fields.description: Task expiration, time at which task definition and status is deleted. Notice that all artifacts for the task must have an expiration that is no later than this
fields.name: expires

fields.description: Unique identifier for a provisioner, that can supply specified workerType
fields.name: provisionerId

fields.description: Number of retries left for the task in case of infrastructure issues
fields.name: retriesLeft

fields.description: Reason for the creation of this run
fields.name: reasonCreated

fields.description: Reason that run was resolved, this is mainly useful for runs resolved as exception
fields.name: reasonResolved

fields.description: Date-time at which this run was resolved, ie. when the run changed state from running to either completed, failed or exception
fields.name: resolved

fields.description: Id of this task run, run-ids always starts from 0
fields.name: runId

fields.description: Date-time at which this run was scheduled, ie. when the run was created in state pending
fields.name: scheduled

fields.description: Date-time at which this run was claimed, ie. when the run changed state from pending to running. This property is only present after the run has been claimed
fields.name: started

fields.description: State of this run
fields.name: state

fields.description: Time at which the run expires and is resolved as failed, if the run isn't reclaimed. Note, only present after the run has been claimed
fields.name: takenUntil

fields.description: Identifier for group that worker who executes this run is a part of, this identifier is mainly used for efficient routing. Note, this property is only present after the run is claimed
fields.name: workerGroup

fields.description: Identifier for worker evaluating this run within given workerGroup. Note, this property is only available after the run has been claimed
fields.name: workerId

fields.description: List of runs, ordered so that index i has runId == i
fields.name: runs

fields.description: All tasks in a task group must have the same schedulerId. This is used for several purposes: it can represent the entity that created the task; it can limit addition of new tasks to a task group: the caller of createTask must have a scope related to the schedulerId of the task group; it controls who can manipulate tasks, again by requiring schedulerId-related scopes; it appears in the routing key for Pulse messages about the task
fields.name: schedulerId

fields.description: State of this task. This is just an auxiliary property derived from state of latests run, or unscheduled if none
fields.name: state

fields.description: Identifier for a group of tasks scheduled together with this task. Generally, all tasks related to a single event such as a version-control push or a nightly build have the same taskGroupId. This property defaults to taskId if it isn't specified. Tasks with taskId equal to the taskGroupId are, by convention, decision tasks
fields.name: taskGroupId

fields.description: Unique task identifier, this is UUID encoded as URL-safe base64 and stripped of = padding
fields.name: taskId

fields.description: Unique identifier for a worker-type within a specific provisioner
fields.name: workerType

description: A representation of task status as known by the queue
name: status

description: Identifier for the worker-group within which this run ran
name: workerGroup

description: Identifier for the worker-group within which this run ran
name: workerId
